arm_group.description: Balance training  will be conducted individually  two times per week for 4 weeks.  Each training session will include virtual reality tasks such as "ankle reaching" and "obstacle crossing" using a virtual obstacle shown on a computer screen. Each session will last 30 - 45 minutes.
The control group will keep their normal activity without receiving any intervention.

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of the present study is to evaluate an innovative  virtual reality-based balance
      training intervention for improving clinically relevant motor performances (balance and
      gait) in older adults.

      We hypothesize that the virtual reality-based balance training intervention will improve
      balance and gait performances in older adults compared to a control group receiving usual
      care only.

clinical_study.brief_title: Virtual Reality-based Exercise in Older Adults

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  ability to ambulate without assistance

          -  willingness to provide informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  severe neurologic, cardiovascular, metabolic, or psychiatric disorders

          -  severe visual impairment

          -  cognitive impairment

intervention.description: Balance training will be conducted individually two times per week for 4 weeks. Each training session will include virtual reality tasks such as "ankle reaching" and "obstacle crossing" using a virtual obstacle shown on a computer screen. Each session will last 30 - 45 minutes.

clinical_study.official_title: Promoting Virtual Reality-based Exercise to Prevent Falls in Older Adults: Pilot Study

Changes in cognitive status will be measured by the Trail Making Test and the Category Fluency Test
Functional performance will be assessed using the Timed Up and Go Test and the Alternate Step Test
